title: church, leadership of
comment: Jesus Christ is the absolute head of the church. He sets leaders in the church to enable the whole church to grow into maturity. Christ's authority in the church is acknowledged more by the church's obedience to God than through any particular form of government.

children.title: Jesus Christ alone is head of the church
The Holy Spirit directs the church
The appointment of leaders in the church

primaryrefs.comment: Judas and Silas were leaders in the Jerusalem church (Ac 15:22).

seealsos.comment: The role of prophets as leaders is distinct from the gift of prophecy, which was in principle available to all

primaryrefs.comment: ``Elder'' and ``overseer'' or ``bishop'' are more or less interchangeable.

children.title: Qualifications for church leadership
children.precomment: The first apostles were witnesses of Jesus Christ's life and resurrection:

children.title: To give direction in church life
To be an example in loving service
To train and appoint other leaders
To exercise discipline in the church
The church's responsibilities to its leaders
To respect and submit to its leaders
The corporate government of the church
In discerning true and false teachings

secondaryrefs.comment: It is unknown whether there were subdivisions of the church in towns such as Corinth
Normally the NT speaks of ``churches'' in an area rather than of a unified regional structure.
